archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: This collection contains tapes, documents, and books on transportation planning. Included is a VHS videotape of footage from 1919 on a US Army convoy traveling across the country on Lincoln Highway, the first transcontinental highway in America.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Jonathan Gifford transportation collection must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jonathan Gifford transportation collection, C0119, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Jonathan Gifford in 1999.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in August 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Jonathan L. Gifford is a Dean in the School of Public Policy at George Mason University, and the director of the Master's in Transportation Policy, Operations and Logistics program.

Dean Gifford's primary area of expertise is transportation and public policy, with a particular focus on transportation and land use. His recent research investigates transportation finance and the role of public private partnerships, and behavioral considerations in transportation planning.

He received a B.S. in Civil Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University, and an M.S. and Ph.D. (1983) in Civil Engineering (Transportation) at the University of California, Berkeley, with doctoral minors in economics, and urban and regional planning. His dissertation examined the history and development of the Interstate Highway System from its origins in the 1930s through its design and deployment in the 1960s and beyond.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains tapes, documents, and books on transportation planning. Included is a VHS videotape of footage from 1919 on a US Army convoy traveling across the country on Lincoln Highway, the first transcontinental highway in America.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds many other .
